concise_definition: n. 矿坑, 采石场; v. (非正式) 大吃大喝, 狂吃

definitions.explanation_en: A large open pit or excavation, especially one used for mining or quarrying materials such as coal, gravel, or stone.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指用于开采煤炭、砾石或石头等材料的大规模露天矿坑或采石场。
definitions.example_en: The old coal bing behind the village has been reclaimed as a nature park.
definitions.example_cn: 村后那个旧煤矿坑已被改造为一个自然公园。

definitions.explanation_en: A period of uncontrolled or excessive consumption of something, especially food, drink, or entertainment, often followed by regret or exhaustion.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指对某种事物（尤其是食物、饮料或娱乐）的失控性或过度消费时期，常伴随后悔或疲惫。
definitions.example_en: After weeks of dieting, she went on a chocolate bing and ate an entire box in one sitting.
definitions.example_cn: 经过几周的节食，她大吃了一顿巧克力，一口气吃掉了一整盒。

definitions.explanation_en: To engage in a period of excessive or uncontrolled consumption, especially of food, alcohol, or media.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指进行一段失控或过度的消费行为，尤指对食物、酒精或媒体内容的沉迷。
definitions.example_en: He binged on Netflix all weekend and didn't leave the couch.
definitions.example_cn: 他整个周末都在狂刷奈飞，一步都没离开沙发。

comparison.analysis: “Quarry” (采石场) 通常特指开采石材、大理石等建筑材料的露天矿场，语义更专业、更具体；而 “bing” 多用于英国英语，泛指各种露天矿坑，语义更宽泛，且常带有废弃或荒废的语境。
“Feast” (盛宴) 指丰盛、有仪式感的聚餐，通常是正面或庆祝性的；而 “binge” 强调的是失控、过度和缺乏节制，常含贬义或自我批评的意味。
“Marathon” (马拉松式活动) 可用于比喻长时间持续的活动（如电影马拉松），但中性或积极；而 “binge” 更强调非理性、成瘾性或健康危害，语义更负面，常用于描述行为失控。
